content.description: The following question refers to the topic of conservatism in the nineteenth century.
content.question: Which of the following best explains the emphasis that many early-nineteenth-century conservative thinkers placed on the value of religious belief in maintaining social stability?

choices.label: They were hoping to encourage the spread of Protestant revivalist ideas such as Methodism.
They were seeking to slow the progress of scientific research by reinforcing the authority of the Roman Catholic Church.
They were reacting to the arrival of increasing numbers of people who practiced non-European forms of religion.
They were responding to the upheaval associated with attempts to supplant Christianity during the radical phase of the French Revolution.

content.answer: They were responding to the upheaval associated with attempts to supplant Christianity during the radical phase of the French Revolution.
